value.title: Biden's AI czar focuses on societal risks, preventing harm
value.excerpt: Robotics scientist Lynne Parker was a pioneer in figuring out how robots could work together to perform difficult missions, like cleaning up after a nuclear disaster, waxing warehouse floors or pulling barnacles off a ship.

value.title: Biological Robots May Soon Build You a Better Heart

value.title: Do AI-powered food robots put human jobs at risk?
value.excerpt: Quick serve is going to the robots thanks to these new machines. Here's why humans stand a chance. Throughout the pandemic, there's been major interest in contactless, automation-driven consumer experiences in the food industry.

value.title: DHL Dials Up Robotics Investment As Delivery Timeframes Shrink

value.title: The Age of Autonomous Killer Robots May Already Be Here
value.excerpt: A “lethal” weaponized drone “hunted down” and “remotely engaged” human targets without its handlers’ say-so during a conflict in Libya last year, according to a United Nations report first covered by New Scientist this week.
